content.question: A wheel initially has angular speed <math alttext="omega sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math> when it begins to accelerate at a constant rate <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>α</mi></mstyle></math>, after which the wheel has angular speed <math alttext="omega sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions is equal to the number of revolutions the wheel goes through while accelerating? Assume that the angular speeds are in <math alttext="radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math> and that the angular acceleration is in <math alttext="radians per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><msup><mtext>s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>.

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator omega sub f minus omega sub i, and denominator 2 pi alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>α</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator omega sub f minus omega sub i, and denominator alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mrow><mi>α</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator omega sub f end sub, squared minus omega sub i end sub, squared, and denominator 4 pi alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>α</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator omega sub f end sub, squared minus omega sub i end sub, squared, and denominator 2 alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>α</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator omega sub f end sub, squared minus omega sub i end sub, squared, and denominator 4 pi alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msubsup><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>α</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
